title: Igor Tudor - Wikipedia
snippet: On 23 March 2025, Tudor replaced Thiago Motta as head coach of Serie A club Juventus. This appointment marked the first time Juventus had appointed a foreign manager since Didier Deschamps in the 2006â€“07 season. He eventually guided the club to the fourth place of league table and Champions ...

title: Igor Tudor is no longer Juventus' head coach - Juventus
snippet: Juventus Football Club announces that it has today relieved Igor Tudor of his duties as head coach of the Men's First Team, along with his staff consisting of Ivan Javorcic, Tomislav Rogic and Riccardo Ragnacci.

title: Igor Tudor to remain as Juventus head coach for 2025-26 season - The Athletic
snippet: Tudor spent much of his playing career with Juventus, making 174 appearances over nine years at the club and winning Serie A in 2002 and 2003. He began his coaching career with Hajduk Split in his native Croatia in 2013 and had spells with PAOK, ...

title: Back in Bianconero | All you need to know about new Juventus coach Igor Tudor - Juventus
snippet: After hanging up his boots and starting his coaching career, he returned to Turin in 2020/21 to work with Andrea Pirlo, offering his experience to the team and helping to win the Italian Cup and Italian Super Cup.

title: Juventus sack coach Igor Tudor after seven months in charge - ESPN
snippet: Tudor played for Juventus for nearly a decade from 1998-2007 and he previously coached Udinese, Hellas Verona and Lazio in Italy.
